items.message:
Rivers remain high and are now rising again due to rainfall.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and checking rivers for blockages.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Don't put yourself or others at risk.

This message will be updated by 10:30 AM on 15/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 15 December 2025, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The forecast is for showers developing today, 15 December 2025, particularly during the afternoon and overnight. Rainfall totals are not expected to be significant. Levels remain high but are starting to drop very slowly. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. Further rainfall is forecast today, 15 December 20215, but no further flooding is expected. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.message:

River levels have fallen below the flood risk threshold on the River Evenlode, and are now below the flood risk threshold along the River Glyme. Levels are expected to contiue falling, and further flooding is not expected in the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 19:00 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. Some rain is forecast to come in Monday evening with further rain possible later in the week keeping river levels high. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high. Flooding is possible today, 15 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall last week. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. Rain is forecast today and overnight, before dry conditions forecast tomorrow. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.34m and is falling. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.00m and is falling. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Pumping operations will continue when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 December 2025 from 11:30 onwards. 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Ashford and Bakewell areas. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48hours. River levels at Ashford in the Water Gauge will begin falling at 05:00 on 16/12/25. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 15 December 2025. River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. Recorded peaks:- Mythe peaked at 3.80m on Thursday 11/12/25 Haw Bridge peaked at 4.75m on Thursday 11/12/25. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message: River levels in West Somerset are rising in response to rainfall this morning, 15 December 2025. Further rainfall is forecast for the rest of today and tonight, then tomorrow will be mainly dry. Flooding is possible on low lying land and roads near the Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Tone, Hillfarrance Brook, Halsewater Stream, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around roads around Hillfarrance, Bradford on Tone, Lane End Road at Ham and the Creech St Michael to Henlade road. Bradford on Tone ringbanks will be bankfull. 

We are closely monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 02:00 PM on 16/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels in the Lower River Calder catchment are rising due to persistent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and currently expected to peak in Mirfield area around 6:00PM, Wakefield around 9:00PM.

Flooding of low lying land is possible on 15 December 2025 until the morning of Tuesday 16 December 2025. There may be surface water flooding issues during the heavier spells of rainfall.

This alert covers the River Calder from Brighouse to Castleford including Chickenley Beck, Spring Mill Beck and Waindike. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Rainfall is expected to continue until the early hours of Tuesday morning.

We are not currently expecting to issue Flood Warnings, but we are monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 8:00PM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Calder, Walsden Water, Hebden Water

items.message:
River levels in the Upper River Calder catchment are rising due to persistent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise before peaking this afternoon.

Flooding of low lying land is possible on 15 December 2025 until the morning of Tuesday 16 December 2025. There may be surface water flooding issues during the heavier spells of rainfall.

This alert covers the River Calder and its tributaries from Todmorden to Brighouse, locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Rainfall is expected to continue until the early hours of Tuesday morning. 

We are not currently expecting to issue Flood Warnings, but we are monitoring the situation.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 December 2025 . 
River levels remain high and are due to rise again due to rainfall today. Flooding is possible on 15 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted Peaks - Llanymynech 3.6 to 4.0m this evening 15/12, Cae Howel currently falling. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Levels remain high today, 15th December 2025, and are expected to remain high for the next few days.
 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. We are not currently expecting to issue flood warnings. Townfield Lane may become cut off again tomorrow, 16th December 2025.
 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area
Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Some further rainfall is expected Friday and across the weekend which may see levels react further.  Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.  We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge.

The lake level will remain high throughout at least Monday (15/12/2025) and Tuesday (16/12/2025), and potentially longer.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

The heavy rain on Sunday (14/12/2025) and in the early hours of Monday (15/12/2025) has caused river levels to rise, peaking at 05:30AM on Monday.

Locations most affected will be properties adjacent to the River Cocker at Southwaite Bridge, including Southwaite Mill.

We continue to monitor the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Cocker and Derwent at Cockermouth, Cricket Ground, Trout Hotel Car Park, Hatters Croft
items.message:
The heavy rain on Sunday (14/12/2025) and in the early hours of Monday (15/12/2025) has caused river levels to rise, peaking in Cockermouth at 05:30AM on Monday.

Locations most affected will be the rivers Cocker and Derwent at Cockermouth, Cricket Ground, Trout Hotel and Market Street Car Parks, Hatters Croft. 

Floodgates have been closed. We continue to monitor the situation and will open floodgates when the water level recedes. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Following heavy rainfall overnight, river levels remain high and flooding is expected on 15 December 2025. Locations most affected will be the river Crake Valley, including Low Nibthwaite, Lowick Bridge, Spark Bridge and Penny Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk and take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 17:00 on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected from the morning of 15 December 2025 . 
Heavy rain falling in the area will continue throughout the day.
Properties and low lying areas will start to flood from around 9:30am on Monday 15 December. The main areas of concern are properties and low lying areas in and around Trenear, including Sawyers Court, Poldark Mine and the B3297. Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas.
River levels are forecast to be at their highest between 1pm and 4pm. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Gowan at Staveley and Ings and River Kent at Staveley
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.
